resources.string: This is the login view. Here the users will be able to introduce their login information\n or login with some social network

This view contains the music library. From this view the user may do the following:

 1. Click on a song, playlist or album and reproduce it
 2. Buy a song
 3. View what's being reproduced
 4. Access the music map

This view contains the song currently being reproduced.\n Here the user may return to the library either by going back or by clicking on details from the song being reproduced.\ The user may also access the music map to view areas where this song is being reproduced.

This view contains a map where the user may view where the song being played is reproduce\n or check out what songs are being played nearby. From this view the user may view the details of a nearby song\n in the library or go back to the song being played.

This view contains the process for carrying out the payment of a song.\n Here the user may return to the library or carry out the purchase.\ In either cases, the user will be sent back to the library in the end.

In order to carry out the payment process, we could use the In-app Billing API which enables carrying out the payment via Google Play. This is a synchronous process that has the advantage that all of the purchase information is stored in Google Play, therefore being accessible at any time in case of having to reset an account.
